US economy slowed to 1.5% rate in second quarter

The economy grew at an annual rate of just 1.5 percent from April through June, the slowest growth in a year, as Americans cut back sharply on spending. (AP, 8:49 a.m.)
  • Government: Great Recession bit less weak than thought

Brown, Warren divided on gun control

Elizabeth Warren’s positions are largely in line with those of gun-control advocates, while Scott Brown had long been endorsed by gun rights groups until he recently broke rank on a high-profile issue. (Boston Globe)
  • Brown to hold boston.com chat at 1:30 p.m.
  • Scott Brown's NRA split wins over Bloomberg

With units as small as 450 square ft., the Boston Wharf Tower in the Seaport District fits Mayor Menino's call for more affordable housing for young professionals. (Globe)
